page.title: 11HEADCORN PRIMARY SCHOOL(2)
page.content: In the{reception class}children are helped to settle into school by being allowed to play with toys,building bricks and sand,as well as being taught gradually to read and write. The next 2{Infant classes}gradually become more and more like a working classroom with mathematics reading writing,science,art and craft and T.V. programmes. The{Juniors}do not play with the Infants and their work is harder too. They begin to work with the Kent Mathematics Project. They also have harder text books and can play games like football and netball. Juniors and Infants make use of the school's 2{micro-computers.}There is a swimming pool and after-school clubs like badminton,choir,table-tennis and gymnastics. About twice a year the Juniors and the Infants produce a play or a show.{It is a very happy school.
